News Application

Models Documentation

This section documents all the Django models in the News Application.

User Model

News application models for managing users, articles, and publications.

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a news article with approval workflow.

This model represents a news article that can be created by journalists, reviewed by editors, and published to readers. Articles go through a status-based approval workflow from draft to published.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – Article title, maximum 200 characters, defaults to None

  • content (str) – Full article content, defaults to None

  • summary (str, optional) – Optional article summary, maximum 500 characters, defaults to empty

  • author (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User with journalist role who authored the article, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher, can be null for independent articles, defaults to None

  • category (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Category for article classification, can be null, defaults to None

  • status (str) – Article status - one of ‘draft’, ‘pending’, ‘approved’, ‘published’, ‘rejected’, defaults to ‘draft’

  • is_approved (bool) – Boolean flag indicating if article is approved, defaults to False

  • approved_by (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to User with editor role who approved the article, can be null, defaults to None

  • approved_at (datetime, optional) – Timestamp when article was approved, can be null, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when article was created, auto-generated

  • updated_at (datetime) – Timestamp when article was last updated, auto-generated

  • published_at (datetime, optional) – Timestamp when article was published, can be null, defaults to None

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = [('draft', 'Draft'), ('pending', 'Pending Approval'), ('approved', 'Approved'), ('published', 'Published'), ('rejected', 'Rejected')]
approve(editor)[source]

Approve article by editor and update status to published.

This method sets the article as approved, updates the status to ‘approved’, records the approving editor and timestamp, then saves the changes.

Parameters:

editor (User) – User instance with editor role who approves the article

Raises:

  • ValueError – If editor is not a valid User instance

  • AttributeError – If editor does not have editor role

approved_at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

independent_author

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class news.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a newsletter created by journalists.

This model represents a newsletter that can be created by journalists and associated with a publisher. Newsletters are typically sent to subscribers and contain curated content.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – Newsletter title, maximum 200 characters, defaults to None

  • content (str) – Newsletter content, defaults to None

  • author (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User with journalist role who authored the newsletter, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher, can be null for independent newsletters, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when newsletter was created, auto-generated

  • updated_at (datetime) – Timestamp when newsletter was last updated, auto-generated

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class news.models.PasswordResetToken(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model for password reset tokens with expiration and usage tracking.

This model represents a secure token used for password reset functionality. Tokens are time-limited (24 hours) and can only be used once to prevent security vulnerabilities.

Parameters:

  • user (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User requesting password reset, required

  • token (str) – Unique token string for password reset, maximum 100 characters, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when token was created, auto-generated

  • is_used (bool) – Boolean flag indicating if token has been used, defaults to False

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

user_id
class news.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a publication/publisher.

This model represents a news publication or publisher that can have multiple editors and journalists associated with it. Publishers can have articles and newsletters created by their associated journalists.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Publisher name, must be unique, defaults to None

  • description (str, optional) – Optional description of the publisher, defaults to empty

  • website (str, optional) – Optional website URL for the publisher, defaults to empty

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when publisher was created, auto-generated

  • editors (ManyToManyField) – Many-to-many relationship to User objects with editor role, defaults to empty

  • journalists (ManyToManyField) – Many-to-many relationship to User objects with journalist role, defaults to empty

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

class news.models.Subscription(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model for managing user subscriptions to publishers and journalists.

This model represents a subscription relationship between a user and either a publisher or a journalist. Users can subscribe to receive content from specific publishers or follow individual journalists.

Parameters:

  • user (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User who is subscribing, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher being subscribed to, can be null if subscribing to journalist instead, defaults to None

  • journalist (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to User with journalist role being subscribed to, can be null if subscribing to publisher instead, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when subscription was created, auto-generated

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

is_editor()[source]

Check if user has editor role.

Returns:

True if user role is ‘editor’, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

is_journalist()[source]

Check if user has journalist role.

Returns:

True if user role is ‘journalist’, False otherwise

Publisher

class news.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a publication/publisher.

This model represents a news publication or publisher that can have multiple editors and journalists associated with it. Publishers can have articles and newsletters created by their associated journalists.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Publisher name, must be unique, defaults to None

  • description (str, optional) – Optional description of the publisher, defaults to empty

  • website (str, optional) – Optional website URL for the publisher, defaults to empty

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when publisher was created, auto-generated

  • editors (ManyToManyField) – Many-to-many relationship to User objects with editor role, defaults to empty

  • journalists (ManyToManyField) – Many-to-many relationship to User objects with journalist role, defaults to empty

exception DoesNotExist

Article

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a news article with approval workflow.

This model represents a news article that can be created by journalists, reviewed by editors, and published to readers. Articles go through a status-based approval workflow from draft to published.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – Article title, maximum 200 characters, defaults to None

  • content (str) – Full article content, defaults to None

  • summary (str, optional) – Optional article summary, maximum 500 characters, defaults to empty

  • author (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User with journalist role who authored the article, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher, can be null for independent articles, defaults to None

  • category (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Category for article classification, can be null, defaults to None

  • status (str) – Article status - one of ‘draft’, ‘pending’, ‘approved’, ‘published’, ‘rejected’, defaults to ‘draft’

  • is_approved (bool) – Boolean flag indicating if article is approved, defaults to False

  • approved_by (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to User with editor role who approved the article, can be null, defaults to None

  • approved_at (datetime, optional) – Timestamp when article was approved, can be null, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when article was created, auto-generated

  • updated_at (datetime) – Timestamp when article was last updated, auto-generated

  • published_at (datetime, optional) – Timestamp when article was published, can be null, defaults to None

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = [('draft', 'Draft'), ('pending', 'Pending Approval'), ('approved', 'Approved'), ('published', 'Published'), ('rejected', 'Rejected')]
approve(editor)[source]

Approve article by editor and update status to published.

This method sets the article as approved, updates the status to ‘approved’, records the approving editor and timestamp, then saves the changes.

Parameters:

editor (User) – User instance with editor role who approves the article

Raises:

  • ValueError – If editor is not a valid User instance

  • AttributeError – If editor does not have editor role

Newsletter

class news.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a newsletter created by journalists.

This model represents a newsletter that can be created by journalists and associated with a publisher. Newsletters are typically sent to subscribers and contain curated content.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – Newsletter title, maximum 200 characters, defaults to None

  • content (str) – Newsletter content, defaults to None

  • author (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User with journalist role who authored the newsletter, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher, can be null for independent newsletters, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when newsletter was created, auto-generated

  • updated_at (datetime) – Timestamp when newsletter was last updated, auto-generated

Subscription

class news.models.Subscription(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model for managing user subscriptions to publishers and journalists.

This model represents a subscription relationship between a user and either a publisher or a journalist. Users can subscribe to receive content from specific publishers or follow individual journalists.

Parameters:

  • user (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User who is subscribing, required

  • publisher (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to Publisher being subscribed to, can be null if subscribing to journalist instead, defaults to None

  • journalist (ForeignKey, optional) – Foreign key to User with journalist role being subscribed to, can be null if subscribing to publisher instead, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when subscription was created, auto-generated

user_id

PasswordResetToken

class news.models.PasswordResetToken(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model for password reset tokens with expiration and usage tracking.

This model represents a secure token used for password reset functionality. Tokens are time-limited (24 hours) and can only be used once to prevent security vulnerabilities.

Parameters:

  • user (ForeignKey) – Foreign key to User requesting password reset, required

  • token (str) – Unique token string for password reset, maximum 100 characters, defaults to None

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp when token was created, auto-generated

  • is_used (bool) – Boolean flag indicating if token has been used, defaults to False
